job_title: Financial Planning Analyst in High Wycombe, England

review_title: Strong sense of social purpose with a commercial mindset for modernity and progress
job_title: Business Partner in High Wycombe, England
pros: Inclusive, friendly, forward thinking and always seeking to improve. Strong social purpose - to house people Also commitment to supporting & signposting our customers and staff especially during cost of living crisis. Genuine acts of kindness - the giving tree at Christmas 2022 where staff bought or donated toys for children's presents, and the same for Christmas food hampers which we wrapped and delivered. Commitment to supporting mental health in the workplace. Good benefits package incl Pension, Health Cash Plan worth over £1,800, holiday - 25 days to start (rising to 30 days with service and automatic for senior roles) PLUS 3 days at Christmas and New year and ability to buy another 5 days . Paid Volunteering days which are encouraged; many of our employees are involved in various altruistic activities. Job shadowing is encouraged to understand how the different functions work together. Internal promotion is encouraged and supported. The Summer BBQ parties are great.
cons: Con’s - Location doesn't suit all, but hybrid working (2 days in the office p/w) reduces frequency of commute.

job_title: Annonymus Employee in High Wycombe, England
pros: Avoid this company as will ruin your mental health
cons: High expectation, nothing given back. Workload for 3 people expected to be done by one person. Not realistic targets and deadlines . Very rude senior management , specially finance. High Employee Turnover. People living without job to go. Bad management style actually no management. Employing people at high level without housing knowledge. They feel like they own you. Long hour’s nothing given back.

job_title: Senior Test Manager in High Wycombe, England
pros:
Lovely people
Caring Company to work for

cons: Business users are very busy with day jobs

review_title: Big company aspirations with social purpose, great opportunities if you work hard
pros: Great opportunities for those who are willing to take them. Generous holidays and benefits, fair pay, lovely people to work with. Good investment in making things better, well intentioned and considers both staff and residents. Admits when things don't quite go right and tries to make things better. Big company aspirations in a small and manageable package. Rewards high performers with career growth opportunities.
cons: Few cons compared to previous employers. Pace of change can be slow, decision making can seem bureaucratic but it is regulated and takes pride in being thorough. Not always the quickest to act on poor staff behaviour, can be frustrating.

job_title: Recruitment Business Partner in High Wycombe, England
pros:
Great people !
Social purpose, values driven organisation
Really good benefits
Always striving for improvement, future proofing and how to make best use of resources
Modern working environment with collaborative working areas - refit underway at time of writing
cons: Location - fine if you have own transport (just off M40) or live near but difficult to get to via public transport

job_title: Anonymous Employee in High Wycombe, England
pros: The main thing is the flexibility they have with working arrangements. You can accrue flexi days by working a little extra each day in addition to your annual leave, as well as arranging 'life admin' like the dentist in working hours and simply leaving early that day or coming in late. The core hours are usually around 37 for office staff and sometimes if it works with your team, you can compress this into 4.5 days. They pay fairly well for the sector. The company generally has a nice atmosphere and staff get along well and are very friendly. A lot of the directors are really approachable and friendly.
cons: Not always great at giving opportunities to internal candidates.

job_title: Facilities & Administrative Coordinator in Chesham, England
pros: A good company to work for with ethics and structures in place.   They encourage advancement within the work force.    They offer a competitive salary and excellent benefits.    If you require training you will receive it.   They have a staff consultative committee where changes are put forward before being rolled out.   Have new CEO Matthew Bailes who is making people accountable  for their actions.
cons: I do not see any cons and feel if staff members are not happy they should look for a new job

Expect you to drive 90minutes in the morning, and 90 minutes in the evening. If you question this expect a disciplinary meeting. Jobs great if you don't consider driving to be work time if you do your working 47.5 hours and getting paid for 40hours. There's also the problem of the planners expecting you to work through your hour break that you don't get paid for too

pros: Friendly people and good main office
cons: Can be difficult to park at main office
